Title: Mercedes helps make coronavirus breathing aid as F1 joins ventilators effort
Content: The Mercedes F1 team has helped develop a breathing aid to keep coronavirus patients out of intensive care, with a host of other rival teams having pitched in to provide UK hospitals with thousands of extra ventilators.

Title: New MI5 chief named as spy who led Skripal poisoning response
Content: A spy who led the response to the poisoning of Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in Salisbury has been named as the new head of MI5.

Title: Surge of 'smishing' scams as criminals exploit coronavirus crisis
Content: The banking industry has warned of a surge in so-called "smishing" scams as criminals try to exploit the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: Crackdown on fake coronavirus advice - from medical 'tips' to tax refunds
Content: The government is cracking down on fake advice spread about the coronavirus, from myths about how to treat symptoms to scam text messages warning people they face jail for leaving their homes.

Title: Friday night under lockdown: The streets may be silent but the fun isn't over
Content: The weekend has arrived and the country is in lockdown.

Title: 'Data platform' will track beds, staff and ventilators
Content: The NHS is preparing to unveil a "data platform" which tracks the movement of critical staff and materials, giving ministers the first ever comprehensive view of the entire health system, Sky News can reveal.

Title: Capturing CO2: How to reduce carbon dioxide emissions from the cement industry
Content: The cement industry is responsible for between 6 to 8 per cent of global carbon dioxide emissions.

Title: How Mars might hold the key to better understanding climate change
Content: It’s been a busy few years for the United Arab Emirates Space programme.

Title: The new coronavirus is hard on older people — and scientists aren't sure why
Content: Older adults appear to be more severely at risk from the new coronavirus, while young children seem to be largely spared — and understanding why could be crucial to treating people with the illness it causes, according to scientists.

Title: Coronavirus mask pushers pump wares on social media
Content: Coronavirus-related products are still for sale across most major social media platforms, including through person-to-person messaging systems, despite some efforts to crack down on black- and grey-market activity around the outbreak.

Title: Stock-trading app Robinhood suffers third outage amid market turbulence
Content: The stock-trading app Robinhood suffered and outage on Monday for the third time in a week, frustrating users of the zero-fee tech startup who tried to place trades during the day's market plunge.

Title: How new rules at Facebook and Twitter led to a warning beneath the president's retweet
Content: A video of Joe Biden that was deceptively edited to make it appear as if he endorsed President Donald Trump for re-election triggered warning labels from Twitter and Facebook, one of the first instances in which new policies meant to curb misinformation have been applied to the Trump campaign.

Title: How EU funding is changing the face of Latvian innovation
Content: At the University of Latvia in Riga, the face of innovation is drastically changing.

Title: Twitter strikes deal with activist investor to keep Jack Dorsey as CEO
Content: Twitter has struck a deal to keep Jack Dorsey as CEO, after an activist hedge fund recently agitated for leadership change at the company.

Title: SXSW conference canceled amid heightened coronavirus concerns
Content: The mayor of Austin, Texas announced on Friday that the city had declared a disaster due to the coronavirus outbreak, a move that resulted in the cancellation of the South by Southwest conference.

Title: In Facebook groups, coronavirus misinformation thrives despite broader crackdown
Content: Facebook's efforts to limit the spread of coronavirus misinformation are running into a problem: groups.

Title: NASA's new Mars rover gets a name — Percy, for short
Content: First came Sojourner. Then Spirit and Opportunity. Curiosity followed. And now there's Perseverance.

Title: Disappearing beaches: Climate change could wipe out half of the world's sandy shorelines
Content: Half of the world's beaches could disappear by the end of this century as a result of climate change-induced coastal erosion and rising seas, according to a study published Monday in thejournal Nature Climate Change.

Title: 'San Francisco is full': Tech backlash reaches new heights with skyscraper battle
Content: SAN FRANCISCO — John Elberling has a drastic plan to address the city's housing crisis: no more new skyscrapers.

Title: Try not to touch your face. Also, try not to think about touching your face.
Content: President Donald Trump confessed Wednesday that for the last few weeks he's been missing something: touching his face.

Title: 2020: A critical year for climate and biodiversity
Content: More than 90% of European citizens say protecting the environment is important to them and more than 80% believe it should be protected by legislation.

Title: Barry Diller weighs in on the Hollywood streaming wars
Content: Barry Diller, the Hollywood mogul who once employed Jeffrey Katzenberg as his assistant, says he is neither bearish nor bullish about Quibi, the new short-form streaming service Katzenberg plans to launch next month.

Title: 'Gardens and graveyards' of coral discovered in hidden canyons off Australia's coast
Content: The South Australian coast is surrounded by a labyrinth of underwater canyons, many of them still unexplored. Last week, an international team of researchers (and their underwater robot companion) completed a survey of three such canyons, uncovering a hidden world of both thriving coral gardens and ash-white coral graveyards.

Title: Bloomberg's novel meme strategy is drawing the wrong kind of buzz
Content: Adrienne Elrod, a Democratic strategist who worked on Hillary Clinton's 2016 campaign, was certain the Mike Bloomberg campaign account had been hacked.
